overlay.name: Sci-Fi Reskin
overlay.description: D&D 5e mechanics reskinned for a space opera setting.
overlay.settingDescription: This overlay reskins standard D&D fantasy elements into a science fiction setting. Magic becomes technology and psionics. Swords become energy blades. The core mechanics remain unchanged, but the flavor transforms the experience into an interstellar adventure.
overlay.author: Squadventure Team

elf.description: An ancient spacefaring species known for their longevity and psionic abilities. The Aeldar were among the first to achieve interstellar travel and their ruins can be found throughout the galaxy.

traitFlavor.Darkvision: Cybernetic ocular implants standard to all Aeldar.
traitFlavor.Trance: Aeldar enter a low-power stasis state instead of sleeping.

dwarf.description: Humans adapted over generations to life in asteroid mining colonies. Shorter and stockier than Terrans, with enhanced constitution for harsh environments.

human.description: Baseline humans from Earth and the core colonies. Adaptable and ambitious, they form the majority of the galactic population.

wizard.description: Individuals with awakened psionic abilities, capable of manipulating reality through mental power alone. Their 'spells' are actually psionic manifestations.

cleric.description: Specialists in advanced medical nanobots and healing technology. Their 'divine' abilities come from cutting-edge biotech implants.

fighter.description: Professional combatants trained in modern weapons and tactics. May serve in military forces or work as mercenaries.

rogue.description: Covert specialists skilled in infiltration, hacking, and precision strikes. Often employed by corporations or intelligence agencies.

settingRules: All 'magic' is actually technology or psionics
FTL travel exists but is expensive and dangerous
Alien species are common in civilized space
The frontier is lawless and dangerous

namingConventions.description: Flowing names with apostrophes and diacritical marks

settingJargon.Void-born: People born in space, never on a planet

dmGuidance.customInstructions: Always use sci-fi terminology instead of fantasy. Describe technology, starships, and alien worlds. Combat involves energy weapons and high-tech armor. 'Magic' effects should be described as psionic phenomena or advanced technology.
dmGuidance.roleplayGuidance: NPCs should reference galactic politics, corporate interests, and space travel. Cantinas replace taverns, space stations replace cities. Wilderness is the void between stars.
